kdl.prox.monet
Class Connection

java.lang.Object
  kdl.prox.monet.Connection

public class Connection
extends java.lang.Object

Represents a connection to a Monet database. Usage:

o open a connection via open() o work with it via executeCommand() or executeQuery() o call close()

Allows to execute commands and queries Actual handling of sessions is left to MonetStream objects

Field Detail

NEW_MONET_PORT_LIMIT

public static int NEW_MONET_PORT_LIMIT

RELEASE_FROM_MONET

public static final boolean RELEASE_FROM_MONET
Flag that indicates whether to actually send commands to Monet to release unused variables. If set to true, a comand var_name:=nil will be sent right away, to tell Monet to release the memory. If set to false, the variable names will be re-used soon, but until then Monet will continue allocating its memory. The benefit is that there is a whole operation that is saved, which is important when performance is an issue (as in a web server) Note that NSTTest.testReleaseInternal will fail if this is set to false Set to true by default.

See Also:

executeAndSave

public static java.lang.String executeAndSave(java.lang.String cmd)
Executes a command and save the results in a variable. NB: Calls to this method should be paired with corresponding calls to releaseSavedVar(). Typically this is done via calling beginScope(), executeAndSave(), then endScope().

Parameters:
cmd -
Returns:
variable name that contains the result of executing cmd

Executes a command and save the results in a variable. NB: Calls to this method should be paired with corresponding calls to releaseSavedVar(). Typically this is done via calling beginScope(), executeAndSave(), then endScope().

Parameters:
cmd -
isIgnore - when true indicates that the variable shouldn't be tracked
Returns:
variable name that contains the result of executing cmd

open

public static void open(java.lang.String host,
                        int port)
Full-arg constructor Prepares a simple connection, and initializes resources Streams to connect to the database server are created when executeCommand or Query are called If the port number is <= NEW_MONET_PORT_LIMIT (40000) then use the new Monet protocol otherwise, use the old Monet (4.6.2) protocol

Parameters:
host -
port -

open

                        int port,
                        int connections)

readValue

public static java.lang.String readValue(java.lang.String query)
Runs a query that returns a single value, single column, and returns that value as a string This is faster than creating the entire resultSet structure.

Parameters:
query -
Returns:
a String (might be 'nil') with the read value

releaseSavedVar

public static void releaseSavedVar(java.lang.String varName)
Called after executeAndSave(), releases the passed varName. NB: This is important because it releases large Monet resources. If ignoreExists, do not show an error if the variable does not exist

Parameters:
varName -
